author: Juliushess
title: Ultra-rare nice little snack of a set
review:
This tiny set was given away for free to owners of early technic sets as promotion in 1977. Thus, value to price ratio is infinite, so to speak. Nowadays, the set is near impossible to find with original bricks and instructions. Due to its history and rarity it is a very interesting technic set.

Is it also a good set? It certainly has its charmes. Basically, what you get is a small crank-driven motor with 1 square cylinder. Gear ratio is very high, so turning the crank results in very satisfying sound and movement. And that's it. Oh, and it is very red.

I see this as an early predecessor to 858/8858 auto engines, a set I truly love.

So is it worth the 25 EUR I paid for an original one with original instructions? For me as a Lego Technic history buff yes! I see this as a jewel in my collection. If you're looking for play value, better look somewhere else.
